iati-activity.title: Affordable appliances for poor people in developing countries
iati-activity.description: This initiative, which DFID is co-funding with the Shell Foundation, will support proof of concept research into reducing the cost and increasing the application of mobile-to-mobile (M2M) technology . M2M technology allows appliances to send and receive data. The project will aim to reduce the cost of producing M2M technology for application in appliances (e.g. for energy, water, health, etc.). and test approaches and applications of this technology that will allow people to pay off the cost of those appliances incrementally as they use them. This should help to reduce the initial outlay of funds which is often prohibitive for the poor. Initial products to be tested will be focused on energy access technologies (such as solar home systems), but results will be relevant for other products in other sectors.

contact-info.mailing-address: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA
